Text: Hi, my hard drive is partitioned with one drive being used to store windows and the original programs stored if laptop needs to be factory reset. Am i able to install windows 7 on there so i dont lose everything else

This is kind of useless - because the one who created it dumped the folder instead of creating a bootable iso.
Not to mention an old version of DAZ-loader (current is 2.0.6) and other odds.

you should have no problem installing over the partion of your comp that just has your OS on it,  it won't touch your partion with files on it. when installing, just tell it to either create a new partion or install over the OS partition... and i am just giving it to you guys as i got it... it works fine for me, i use it for my business and never had any complaints after installing it.

I have used the "Windows Loader 1.9.zip" from this torrent to activate my preloaded ultimate 64-bit version using VMware and it activated like charm.

Thanks!
